message:
--cutting and soldering 55 meters of led tape (provided) into about
30 segments and attaching cable connectors (provided) at the ends.

 --cutting aluminum channel (provided) into equal segments

 --affixing the led tape to the channels

 --outfitting the sections with hardware as needed to secure the
pieces 1)to each other, and for half of them, 2)in an easily
attachable and detachable way to upright pipes.

 --cutting and capping several four 6' sections of wide-diameter pvc
pipe for the segments to travel in

led tape--this, or similar: http://www.sparkfun.com/products/10260

it's 24 1.75m pieces, and 12 smaller pieces.

3 or 4 aluminum pieces will need to attach to each other, in perfect
lines, and join with cable connectors, to make longer sections.
half of the pieces angle vertically, half of them sit flat on the floor.

all the connections need to be durable and waterproof.

all the power and control is taken care of by someone else, everything
will be outfitted to just accept the connectors youd be
putting on the strips.
(http://media.digikey.com/photos/Tyco%20Photos/284506-3.JPG i think.)

a shipping method needs to be devised for all the strips--likely
capped PVC tubing.
